result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Lamario D Johnson in court.

Court will appoint counsel to represent the defendant.
Defendant to pay $25.00 per month commencing 9-15-2022.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to discuss this case with Aqwon C. listed in the Criminal Complaint.

02:20 PM Defendant Lamario D Johnson in court, in custody, with attorney Cassandra A Miller.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Miller appears as friend of the court.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
